rules: Rule1: Provided that a facility has proprietary data, then the publication is not open access.
Rule2: If a publication has high impact, then it is in a prestigious journal.
Rule3: Whenever a publication is widely cited, it follows that it has high impact.
Rule4: Under the condition that an organization publishes a preprint of a publication, that organization publishes the publication.
Rule5: If an organization is in a legal dispute with a facility, then a settlement is reached between the organization and the facility.
Rule6: Either an organization engages in mediation with a facility, or if an organization is in a legal dispute with a facility, then it is not the case that a settlement is reached between them.
Rule7: Provided that a facility conducts research leading to a publication, then the publication is peer-reviewed.
Rule8: Either a facility conducts research leading to a publication, or an organization provides grant funding to a facility.
Rule9: If a publication is peer-reviewed, then the publication is retracted.
Rule10: If a publication is cited, then the publication is not retracted.
Rule11: Either a publication is open access, or if a publication is peer-reviewed, then the publication is cited.

Rule12: If it is not the case that if it is not the case that either an organization collaborates with a facility or if it is not the case that an organization provides grant funding to a facility then the organization publishes a publication, then the organization funds the facility, then the facility shares data with the organization.

Rule13: Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that either an organization collaborates with a facility or if it is not the case that an organization provides grant funding to a facility then the organization publishes a publication, then the organization funds the facility, then the publication is not in a prestigious journal.

Rule14: If it is not the case that if it is not the case that if it is not the case that either an organization collaborates with a facility or if it is not the case that an organization provides grant funding to a facility then the organization publishes a publication, then the organization funds the facility, then the publication is widely cited, then the publication is controversial.

Rule15: Under the condition that it is not the case that if it is not the case that if it is not the case that either an organization collaborates with a facility or if it is not the case that an organization provides grant funding to a facility then the organization publishes a publication, then the organization funds the facility, then the publication is widely cited, then the publication is not controversial.

Rule16: If it is not the case that if it is not the case that an organization provides grant funding to a facility, then the organization publishes a publication, then an organization is in a legal dispute with a facility.

Rule17: Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that an organization provides grant funding to a facility, then the organization publishes a preprint of a publication, then the publication is embargoed.
facts: Fact1: A facility has proprietary data.
Fact2: It is not the case that an organization publishes a publication.
Fact3: It is not the case that a publication is embargoed.
Fact4: It is not the case that an organization engages in mediation with a facility.
Fact5: It is not the case that an organization collaborates with a facility.
Fact6: It is not the case that an organization funds a facility.
Fact7: It is not the case that a facility shares data with an organization.

question: An organization provides grant funding to a facility.
